TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit CacheEntryChangeMonitor extends System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor

Docs.summary: Provides a base class that represents a type that can be implemented in order to monitor changes to cache entries.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor> class provides abstract, read-only properties that can be implemented for monitoring cache entries. This class is used when a cache implementation has to monitor changes to entries in its own cache. For caches that are <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache> cache implementations, an instance of the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor> type is returned by the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.CreateCacheEntryChangeMonitor%28System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable%7BSystem.String%7D%2CSystem.String%29> method.

block.para: For information about the inheritance contract that must be followed, see the information for inheritors in the class overview.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor is called from constructors in derived classes to initialize the base class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor> class has a default constructor.

block.para: The constructor of a derived class must set the property, begin monitoring, and call before the constructor returns. If a dependency changes before initialization is complete (for example, if a dependent cache key is not found in the cache), the constructor must call the method. The constructor can call the method only after is called, because throws an exception if initialization is not completed.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of cache keys that are monitored for changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The collection is typically set in the constructor of a derived <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor> type.

Docs.summary: Gets a value that indicates the latest time (in UTC time) that the monitored cache entry was changed.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If multiple cache entries are being monitored for changes, the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor.LastModified%2A> property returns the latest time a modification occurred in any of the cache entries.
The value of the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor.LastModified%2A> property is typically calculated during initialization of a derived class.

Docs.summary: Gets the name of a region of the cache.
Docs.value: The name of a region in the cache.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this property typically indicates a particular region where changes are monitored in the cache. The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor.RegionName%2A> property provides the option to configure change monitors so that they monitor cache entries only in a specific cache region.
